snippet: Twenty thousand years ago, the first modern humans who arrived in the Mediterranean region around Sicily ate very little seafood, researchers report.
abstract: Dr Marcello Mannino study in journal PLoS One finds that ancient humans living in Mediterranean region around Sicily 20,000 years ago ate very little seafood.
lead_paragraph: Twenty thousand years ago, the first modern humans who arrived in the Mediterranean region around Sicily ate very little seafood, researchers report.

headline.print_headline: Mediterranean Settlers Had Little Taste for Fish
headline.seo: Early Mediterranean Settlers Ate Little Seafood
headline.main: Mediterranean Settlers Had Little Taste for Fish
